intro: Dipterostele tanii, commonly known as the Japanese dipterostele, is a rare and unique plant native to Japan. It belongs to the family Dipterostelaceae and is characterized by its distinctive, spirally arranged leaves. The plant exhibits a unique vascular system with a dipterostele, which is a type of complex vascular structure. It typically grows in moist, shaded environments, such as mountain forests. Due to its limited distribution and specific habitat requirements, it is considered a rare and ecologically significant species.
